website_summaries.verdict: Use this deep-channeled ball indoors or outdoors – just know that it loses its grip when wet.
pros: Deep channel design for better dribble control
Foam backing under the full-ball pebbling for precise handling
Very grippy, except when it gets wet

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball
customer_reviews.text: Love this ball. It will wear out eventually if used outdoors. I can't say enough how this I/O ball feels like the game balls used indoors. I bought two, my son keeps one for practice outdoors in the driveway, the other to take to school to use in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: ETChua

customer_reviews.title: Expected more
customer_reviews.text: While it felt great out of the box and for a few weeks after, it wore fast with indoor use and just a small amount of bouncing outdoors (not full game play). We expected more from such a highly rated ball. It's too hard and smooth now. Personally, I feel their are better options at the local brick and mortar stores. It holds air fine and the size is good. It's just too smooth for indoor, and wears too easily for outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Xina143

customer_reviews.title: He shoots... but never scores.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews aren’t my thing but I figured it’s 2018 so why not. This ball bounces. It can bounce high or low depending on how much force you put into moving it. I feel like Larry Bird shooting this thing. Wind in my hair, I shoot... beautiful backspin on it due to the lovely grip and feel (I can palm this thing and I have hobbit hands)... unfortunately my shot is about as bad as this review. It’s a good ball. Good game. It’ll probably serve you well if you keep out out the rain and don’t lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Skipp H.

customer_reviews.title: No Manufacturer Packaging!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the ball as pictured but be cautioned! It does not come in the manufacturer's packaging. Just the ball in a crunched shipping box. I ordered this for a gift and am very disappointed. It looks like I purchased it from a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Karlinka

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than Professional size!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to order this ball as it has great reviews but when it was delivered it did not come in any type of original packaging and more importantly the size was smaller than a professional ball by at least .5 to an inch. Felt more like a women's professional ball. What I'm guessing is they bought these balls in balk off of a product recall for it being to small and just shipped them. If you are expecting a men's professional size ball this is not it. I've played basketball my whole life and knew instantly it was small.
customer_reviews.author: Basketball B

customer_reviews.title: Okay for outdoors, not so much for indoors
customer_reviews.text: Got this ball based on recommendations I read online. This ball is not too great for indoors. I realize it's an indoor/outdoor ball, so it's not optimum for indoors, but I've seen better indoor/outdoor balls. It's a bit stiff and not supple. It doesn't have the good tack you expect when using a ball indoors. It's okay for outdoors since it has to hold up to rougher surfaces and it seems pretty durable, although I've been using it mainly indoors as a backup. The Wilson Evolution is much better for indoors, although it costs about $20 more.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice ball but a little pricey given the immediate peeling of the cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball because it was an NBA sized all-surface ball. After using it for 3-4 hours I see some areas where the covering is beginning to peel off the rubber (see picture). This is too be expected after some time, but this seemed pretty quick. Well be monitoring it further during the return window. Otherwise it is a very nice ball, with good grip and consistent bounce.
customer_reviews.author: allyk

customer_reviews.title: Just like I remembered it.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best balls kids would bring to high school. I started playing again and decided to get what was like a luxury back then. It's still great. Color, weight, softness, and quality all great. I use it outdoor so it gets dusty and is quickly not sticky anymore but it's still not bad. It's got good padding. I don't play a lot but durability after maybe 6 hours of play seems fine. I also keep it in the garage away from sun and rain. I don't know how it will hold up if used daily for 2 or 3 hours but nothing will be durable under those conditions except a rubber ball
customer_reviews.author: Derek S Xie

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size for 5th Grade!
customer_reviews.text: I never realized that there's actually a size-difference for my 5th grade basketball player, whereas I've been buying him adult "regular" balls all this time. This is a terrific, thick, good traction ball, that actually does look like leather (it's darker than the photo). He uses it outside and inside and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Good.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good but I would like it to have more grip. To ke it feels a bit slippery. I prefer the molten ball. But people say the molten ball feels heavier. Still very good for the price. Way better than balls at Walmart or target. Csn tell the difference. This is a 4 and ealmart or targets are 3s.
customer_reviews.author: Daozer

customer_reviews.title: Poor bounce quality
customer_reviews.text: We got this ball for outdoor and indoor play. We used it first for indoor play and we noticed that it the bounce was really weird with it. It was almost like we were hitting dead spots on the floor constantly, but there are none there. We also tried out Baden Elite and the Baden performed perfectly, but everytime we used this ball it seemed like we were hitting dead spots. I can't recommend this ball unless you are completely one that doesn't care..
customer_reviews.author: KSG

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor ball, with versatility to use indoors as well
customer_reviews.text: What you'd expect from a Spalding. Not a big fan of the barcode on the ball itself though because you lose a bit of grip there should your fingertips come across it while shooting or handling the ball. I feel like the dimples should encompass the entire ball except where the usual logos are, and for that reason, it only gets 4 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Khoa Cao

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and excellent grip.
customer_reviews.text: Great grip and feels good to the touch. Only had it for about a week or so and plan on using it outdoor. So let’s see how well it holds up. So far so good. Cause I used a Spaulding never flat lasted a decent time outdoors and the Spaulding b-ball from Costco that didn’t last 2 months on cement.
customer_reviews.author: William Tuanhuu Pham

customer_reviews.title: No Bounce
customer_reviews.text: This ball has some good reviews, but I am not impressed. It is like dribbling on a dead spot on the floor when there is no dead spot. There must be something wrong with the bladder. Not sure if this is an authentic Spaulding. I usually have 0 problems with them. Disappointed when it was a $30 ball. I didn’t expect the greatest for that price, but I expected it to do better than the $5 ball my daughter got for her birthday. Maybe it was just a lemon of a ball, but... It’s already on its way back.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: It keeps deflating
customer_reviews.text: This was the second time I buy this product. First one was AWESOME. Served me some great games for over 3 years. However, this one , even though has the same great grip and material, it keeps on DEFLATING. Every day I have to inflate the ball. I received a faulty product. What can I do?
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Zedan

customer_reviews.title: Probably not a real Spalding
customer_reviews.text: The ball just came in a cardboard box not in the original package it should have been in and it looks uneven and kind of warped I don't know if this is some kind of knock off. It just looks like crap and it feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good grip for outdoors but panels are starting to come unglued
customer_reviews.text: The ball has good grip and I use it very often but not to long after I got the panels started to come unglued. The ball has good consistent grip even when it gets a dirty from playing outdoors but will be trying a new ball maybe Wilson Brand or different Spalding ball because of the panels starting to come off.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gibson

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best choice if you're looking for a basketball!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality leather and workmanship on this basketball. It was a Christmas gift a year ago and it has performed beautifully. It feels great when dribbling, shooting, and passing, and it has not worn down due to weather. This is a top notch choice for anyone looking for a basketball that is durable and breaks in well.
customer_reviews.author: Jen-Knee

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the quiality I wanted. Very tacky (grippy), feels like a more expensive ball. Seems like it would hold up outside, but I doubt I will use it outside because I dont want to mess up the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come in Spalding packaging, lost air
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come in Spalding packaging, needed to be inflated and lost air after about a month
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good Outside Basketball
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good basketball or outside. Will know a lot more about it's durability after I use it more times.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Harding

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip at first, fades fast, but otherwise works fine.  Happy with mine after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Working great on my neighborhood smooth-concrete court. Lost the "tack" grip feel pretty quickly, but works fine otherwise. Had mine about a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffersonian

customer_reviews.title: Good ball
customer_reviews.text: Have played for 3 month outdoor. The ball is getting more comfortable after some games.
customer_reviews.author: Songchen L.

customer_reviews.title: Fake zi/o excel
customer_reviews.text: I've used the zi/o excel for several years so I know a fake when I spot it. The basketball came in a box within a box not the original box that surrounds the ball. The grip is awful, the texture of the ball feels cheap. The labels of the ball are also different than the original zi/o excel. The original ball is made in China but the one I received was made in Vietnam.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Ball Too Expensive to Have ANY Defects
customer_reviews.text: Came properly inflated, but was poorly put together. Some seams were coming up. Though it was new, some spots looked like a worn ball would look. Ball is too expensive to have ANY defects. I did not receive a one off bad ball, as other reviewers have said the same thing. Better to just buy from Wal-Mart, where you can examine before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: TMoney

customer_reviews.title: Great price and grips well
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the Spalding basketballs you find in stores says official weight but they do feel a bit lighter. Not this one though. It feels like the right weight and grips well as long as you use it indoors. I use this primarily for outdoor use and it got slippery within 5 mins. Just use some soap and water to wipe it afterwards and it'll be fine. For the price, you cant find a better basketball. Check all the reviews that say the same.
customer_reviews.author: ezklipze

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good, discount basketball. Mostly used for outdoor play, but when it is on the newer side, it is good enough to be used indoors as well. I think this is the best ball for rugged outdoor play. Feel is good, bounces nicely and is one of the more durable balls that Spalding makes. Good ball for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great buy son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and has survived Florida summer hot asphalt. Bought for son -no complaints
customer_reviews.author: EBDesigner

customer_reviews.title: Nice outdoor ball
customer_reviews.text: This ball has held up better than any ball I played with for awhile. It is comparable with the spalding gold....it's only fault was that it is a little warped. Hopefully the next one I buy would be perfect......but it still plays well even in that state.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Beware. Goes flat quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Great grip and feel. Loses its tackiness rather quickly. Comes fully inflated. Seems rather on the heavy size. However the ball that i got had trouble inflating about a week after it arrived. And now when i do manage to inflate it, it loses air extremely quickly. It goes flat in a matter of days. I have to inflate it every time prior to going to the gym. I saw similar comments talking about the ball's difficulty to inflate but i went against my better judgement and got it anyway. Look out for this problem and if u see any signs of a similar issue return it before it is too late.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not what I paid for..
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying the basketball that the description clearly stated. But as I opened my package I realized that I may have been scammed because inside was a junior sized Spalding basketball that looked NOTHING like the item I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: James Howard

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed.. the ball came in a beat up box and wasn’t even in the balls original box. Definitely not the full 29.5 size ball that I ordered. Save yourself some time and just order the ball directly from Spalding. This ball sounds like it’s flat, even with air in it. Will not purchase from here again.
customer_reviews.author: MRob2009

customer_reviews.title: Can't hold air
customer_reviews.text: The basketball arrived partially deflated (despite product description claiming it arrives inflated and game ready). A few hours after pumping it with air, the ball deflated again. After many attempts, the ball would only hold air for a couple of hours before becoming flat again. Also, the ball is warped in multiple spots.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Spalding
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased other basketballs before , I've always had the same problem , they end up tearing up the outside until the outside is no longer recognizable , with this one that hasn't been the case . This basketball has withstood way longer before it starts showing the wear of a concrete basketball court . Definitely will buy again !
customer_reviews.author: wess

customer_reviews.title: Not great. The look and feel are good
customer_reviews.text: Not great. The look and feel are good, but my ball had durability issues. After less than 12 hours of play time my ball has developed a bump that is significant enough to make it unusable for anything but shooting. All 12 hours of use have been outdoors, but I don't sit on my ball or use it irregularly. While I may have simply received a defective ball, I will choose a different brand the future.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Claremore

customer_reviews.title: Peeled off after less than 50 hours of play outdoors.  First ever.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ball in March 2015. Played with it indoor/outdoor less than 50 hours - because I have 5 other balls to "rotate" - and last week the outer layer just peeled off. This is the first time spalding ball peeled off . Some other balls (Spalding and other brands) went through 2-3 years and didn't peel off.
customer_reviews.author: paul key

customer_reviews.title: Great ball so far
customer_reviews.text: Great Basketball. Perfect for indoor and outdoor use. We have used this indoor and outdoor and had no problems so far. I will update this review if we have any problems that others have had with separation, but so far so good. Great ball for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: its easy to
customer_reviews.text: When ball delivered to the address, its full of air...which suppose to empty (or "inflate")...due to that, we found more difficulties to take this ball during our air travel...next time, when you deliver the ball to anyone, please deliver without AIR....its easy to carry
customer_reviews.author: Sureshkumar

customer_reviews.title: Great all around ball.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 as gifts for basketball fanatics and they raved about them so much I bought one for myself- great basketball.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence E Beverly III

customer_reviews.title: Everything seems good but I was a little put off that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems good but I was a little put off that it didn't come in some kind of packaging, not sure if that's normal but I've never seen them sold that way so
customer_reviews.author: aleura alava

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent substitute of the NBA official basketball to be used on just about any surface.
customer_reviews.author: Mario R. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Best Basketball
customer_reviews.text: Perfect basketball! It has great grip and feels great to play with. I replaced a similar ball purchased from Target 1 month ago. This ball is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hartye

customer_reviews.title: As seen on the web
customer_reviews.text: Everything was just as good as seen on the web. Pretty good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Baccaro

customer_reviews.title: Great value, fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Super quick delivery, and a really nice ball. Can't wait to play!
customer_reviews.author: R. Rios

customer_reviews.title: NBA Basketball
customer_reviews.text: My son-in-law loved the basketball. He is actually a hall of famer from his college days, holding the record for many years with the most 3 points in his career. His name is William (Bill) Elliott. He's very happy with the basketball and is currently building a half court in his backyard for his son.
customer_reviews.author: allene

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best balls you can buy. Cheaper than the version below this one they sell at Wal-Mart. This is the advanced ball version and it is amazing. Ive had this ball for about a month now and it is holding up just fine. I play on a painted court outdoors and have no issues with this ball Great buy, recommend to anyone looking for a great ball for a cheap price for the quality you get.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Good Basketball
customer_reviews.text: Got this ball for my 9 y/o based on other reviews which claim this is a solid go to ball. He's a thin kid, and reviews said the ball felt lighter, so that may be a plus for a skinnier kid. He shoots and dribbles it well and its working out great!
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: "GREAT OUTDOOR BALL"
customer_reviews.text: Buy this for play outdoors, great ball, good grip, its hard to slip in your hands. Nice feel when you dribling, the composite leather its perfect no heavy and DURABLE. I have this about 2 years (play 4 days in a week) still in good condition. After use several brands and types of balls i find this, This is a good ball you dond regreat.
customer_reviews.author: HAROLD

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good ball, not the best feel. But, good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basketball. I've experienced None of the problems other reviewers have. If u wipe the ball down after outdoor play it will retain tackiness.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Not inflated, jump low
customer_reviews.text: The feel on the surface is OK. Overall is good. But bc its not inflated and ready for game. I have to give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: colmiral

customer_reviews.title: Fake Fake Fake
customer_reviews.text: Fake...Fake...Fake...Rubber on inside with stick on logos that peeled off after a days usage.....
customer_reviews.author: Green Destiny

customer_reviews.title: My husband cherishes this ball! Keeps it safe in ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband cherishes this ball! Keeps it safe in his bag and doesn't let everyone play with it. Only close friends.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Goes flat fast! lasted 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The ball is great as long as it stays inflated. I love the grip on this ball. I have relatively small hands and because of the grip I can actually palm the ball. The quality of the ball is great but it is definitely an indoor ball. This ball lasted 2 weeks on my outdoor court and now it goes flat everyday. This is ridiculous. I had a Spalding infusion ball and it lasted 5 years in my court. I wish I could get a refund or at least a replacement. If you're playing indoor this is a great ball. If you're playing outdoor keep looking this isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Heder Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: great ball and good price. it came very fast. surprisingly it came without packaging from spalding, but looked, felt, and smell brand new. very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: The ball has great grip and feel. It was perfectly round upon delivery. However, the ball was not put together well. Glue protrudes from the black lines, and sections of the leather are sticking up. So far it has done its job indoors. I will not use this ball outdoors, because it will likely fall apart before the end of the first game.
customer_reviews.author: borzy

customer_reviews.title: Nice basketball! Good feel and grip
customer_reviews.text: Nice basketball! Good feel and grip, seems like it is standard size as well. This was a xmas present for a 12yo, worked out so well that we shot some hoops a few hours later. No complaints so far!
customer_reviews.author: theunartistTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: They do last a good 6-8 months but I was hoping more for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish these lasted longer for outdoor play. They do last a good 6-8 months but I was hoping more for a year. Also note that I play on Asphalt surface, about two times a week for about 2 hours each session. I keep buying this model over and over whenever my old ball loses grip.
customer_reviews.author: Milan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for outdoor
customer_reviews.text: Better than the other Spalding classic indoor outdoor, slightly more durable than a under armour 495
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: This ball does not bounce well or stay inflated. Would like to return.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Better than a low end ball but not as good ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little small in my hand though it appears to be sized right. Has a hard feel and slick cover. Better than a low end ball but not as good as the tf1000 or evolutions. Priced right at $25 when I purchased
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaDadof4

customer_reviews.title: middle school basketball team is happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased twice...middle school basketball team is happy with them... do see some breakage on the surface which concerns me a bit...not sure if with outdoor games it would last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Great ball for my 5 yr old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to start playing basketball. Her summer camp is using this same ball as well. She and I both love the way it feels in the hands. It's soft but yet very bouncy. It's also got that nice stickiness to it. It makes the tape-peeling sound off our wooden floor! Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: ♚ ♛ ♜ ♝ ♞ ♟ ♔ ♕ ♖ ♗ ♘ ♙

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for indoors!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love to play basketball and when I play I take it seriously. I NEED to play with a legitimately good ball (official size and all) and that's EXACTLY what I received! To be perfectly honest, the ball that came in was exactly what I was looking for it has great grip and comes in its original Spalding container box. Great product, definitely happy with my purchase... Now I just need to find some descent ankle braces
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels good, looks bad
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I have been using this ball mostly outdoors. The ball is almost too sticky in the beginning but it felt much better after a few uses. However, the ball also starts looking REALLY bad once the super sticky layer wears off. I would still recommend this ball for those who care more about how a ball feels than how it looks.
customer_reviews.author: tgstm87

customer_reviews.title: Good for outdoor play for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is ok at best. Not recommended for indoor play, more for outdoor. Feels cheap and the balance is not perfect so affected shooting.
customer_reviews.author: dgaz2003

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This is not an indoor leather basketball and came with no tags, box, or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Artmom27

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality ball
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality ball. My 11 year old daughter didn't like the "tacky feel" of the new ball. Now that's been used a few months, it's not so tacky and she likes it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Seanookie

customer_reviews.title: my first basketball!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the $$. Great for outdoor use. stick to the hand and not easily slip away. Durable too. Been using it almost daily and still in excellent shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed to report the leather seems to be coming apart ...
customer_reviews.text: Had ball for about a year now with moderate use. Very disappointed to report the leather seems to be coming apart at some parts, making the ball useless to play with. I will be contacting Spalding for a replacement. Grip will eventually wear out from outdoor play, which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good for outdoor and indoor use- has to add air when I received it
customer_reviews.author: Lijo Kochupaul

customer_reviews.title: Good times
customer_reviews.text: Nice basketball, mainly used it at the park and driveway with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: I

customer_reviews.title: Great youth ball.
customer_reviews.text: Good bouncer and just the right amount of tacky. This is size recommended by the youth basketball camp. My sone is in the 8-10 class and they suggest this little bit smaller ball. His coach complemented on what a good ball this was. Price was lower than the local big-box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. Jiskra

customer_reviews.title: who loved it! Nice feel
customer_reviews.text: I just gave it to my son, who loved it! Nice feel, texture. Almost too nice to use, he said. I've paid this much for basketballs that weren't as nice. Time will tell the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Indoor ball we take to the YMCA and play with ...
customer_reviews.text: Indoor ball we take to the YMCA and play with the kids. Works outside too but son is protective and won't let us use it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Reading mom

customer_reviews.title: Does not last!!!
customer_reviews.text: We got this ball for my son at Christmas. We live in northern Pennsylvania so he just had weather to use it. 2 trips to the basketball courts and the ball is smooth! Not worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Guilds

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: At my pickup game, this is the second choice ball - my cousin has an Evolution that is the first choice if he is there. People complain, occasionally, about the texture of the ball, which is somewhat sticky/tacky but then slick at the NBA logo. Primarily as an excuse for a missed shot or mishandled pass. But they still choose to play with it over most other balls present.
customer_reviews.author: K. Veeraraghavan

customer_reviews.title: The ball is stained, it has different colors exactly ...
customer_reviews.text: The ball is stained, it has different colors exactly where the box packaging borders are. It seems that it was a sampling item, exposed for a long time at the shelf. Is it possible to replace it?
customer_reviews.author: AFLG

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: Fine for shooting with or running dribbling drills, but its no game ball. Any ball used in a game is gonna get a little sweat on it, and when this thing does it becomes unusable. Sweat on this ball and its useless, the cheapo beat up balls at my gym handle moisture better.
customer_reviews.author: Somepersononline

customer_reviews.title: My stepson loved it! Perfect for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: Very well made basketball! My stepson loved it! Perfect for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: OK if your outdoor court is perfectly clean.
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I expected. Panels are peeling off before i even started using it. Quickly picks up dirt and looses all benifit. There's an outdoor "street" ball, that's 1/2 the price and works just as good.
customer_reviews.author: RSS Sief

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is this was an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: @therealmdd

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a decent outdoor ball for my 10 year old that wouldn't break the bank. It is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandie Robb

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, too bad both my boys already had ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 years in a row I've bought 2 at a time. Great quality, too bad both my boys already had them stolen and they were Christmas gifts 😡
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold air.
customer_reviews.text: The grip and the covers durability would get 4/5 or 5/5 stars. However in just a few DAYS the ball looses air, and not just a little bit that's barley noticeable. It looses enough air to make the ball incapable of bouncing. Would look for a different ball if purchasing again for a ball for frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Grohl

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ball , great value for money
customer_reviews.text: after using it few times the ball becomes great, good weight, good grip ,high value for money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll need Jordan's Secret Stuff after use
customer_reviews.text: Good indoor ball, poor grip outside on courts susceptible to dust/dirt. Me and my friend are on career-worst shooting slumps because of this. We feel like Charles Barkley and Patrick Ewing after the Monstars took their talent in Space Jam.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Best basketball for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is the best basketball around. Very good grip and is durable. Hits the sweet spot for price/performance.
customer_reviews.author: socal16

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than regulation
customer_reviews.text: Basketball says official size, but is definitely smaller - plays like a jr or womans bball
customer_reviews.author: Azad A. Yakatally

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend more for indoor use than outdoors just to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of tacky grip. My son likes it.Would recommend more for indoor use than outdoors just to keep the good grip.
customer_reviews.author: J40

customer_reviews.title: Higher Quality - Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball. Great grip/high quality. This is always the game ball whenever we play pickup. The price isn't bad and this is better than anything they sell at Dicks. The price is good too, so if you're looking to spend a little extra in order to get high quality, the Zi/O Excel is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Paez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Only had to put air in it once and it has held up great. Highly recommend as it is one of the best outdoor basketballs that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Castro

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy another
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid basketball. Maintains air pressure well, solid feel in the hands and texture is good for an indoor/outdoor ball. Slightly on the rubbery side compared to other indoor/outdoor balls, but overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sheeder

customer_reviews.title: Did not like that at all
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the ball it did not come in the original box which was odd because the other ball I ordered from the same place at the exact same time did come in the box. Did not like that at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This ball has amazing grip! My players really love the ball. Its not bad for a decent price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mid range ball, great features for value
customer_reviews.text: Great ball and had great price through Amazon for like lack Friday. Good quality mid range ball. (Not a high end indoor only game ball, but great choice for the price/ pickup games)
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best ball for outdoor court.
customer_reviews.text: Great ball, great price. Looks and feels like an official indoor ball. Won't dry rot if left outside like rubber balls.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Monteleone

customer_reviews.title: Not the best ball for dribbling drills.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ball for my son, looks to be a nice ball with good grip. However the ball does not have much bounce when dribbling compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: A.Vorst

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great indoor ball. Good grip and has lasted for some time now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew2526

customer_reviews.title: Preferably indoor ball
customer_reviews.text: I use this ball for outdoors and indoors, but after some use it's obvious that this ball is better suited for indoor play. However, what ball isn't like that? The ball is great in terms of grip and size though, being a standard regulation basketball. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

product_meta.title: Spalding NBA Zi/O Excel Basketball
product_meta.description:
SPALDING ZI/O EXCEL
The Spalding 64-497 Zi/O Excel is a pure example of everything an indoor/outdoor basketball should be. The official ball of the NBA, it meets all stringent official size and weight specifications. The composite leather construction features the addition of a foam backing under the full ball pebbling to make handling even more precise. The deep channel design is 30 percent deeper for even better grip and dribble control. Additionally our Zi/O Excel ball has a composite leather cover along with deep channel grooves for better dribble control. This ball is designed for competitive indoor or outdoor play.


DURABLE COVER WITH THE COMPETITIVE PLAYER IN MIND
Material composition, feel, and weight are all important when it comes to competitive play. The Spalding Zi/O is made with a touch composite leather cover to maintain a soft feel and maintain durability in both indoor and outdoor environments, without compromising on ball weight or bounce.


OFFICIAL SIZE AND WEIGHT
 Each NBA game ball sports the official NBA logo for an authentic NBA look and feel.


FOAM BACKING DESIGN FOR ENHANCED FEEL AND GRIP
The Spalding Zi/O cover is lined with foam backing to create an improved soft feel and touch, as well as provide a good grip to the ball.





Zi/O Excel comes in both Official Size and Intermediate Size KEY BENEFITS
 * Exclusive Zi/0 PU composite cover
 * Foam backed design for improved feel and grip ability
 * Designed for indoor/outdoor play
 * Official NBA size and weight



BRAND STORY
About Spalding 

A Division of Russell Brands, LLC, Spalding is the largest basketball equipment supplier in the world, and America's first baseball company. Spalding is the official basketball of the National Basketball Association (NBA) and Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA), the official backboard of the NBA and NCAA, the official baseball of the Little League World Series, the official volleyball of the King of the Beach Volleyball Tour and of the "Pro Beach Series" and the official football of Pop Warner. In addition to being a leading producer and marketer of basketballs, footballs, volleyballs and soccer balls, Spalding produces softballs under the Dudley brand. The SPALDING and DUDLEY trademarks are owned by Russell Brands, LLC.



BUYING GUIDE
 spalding basketball size guide 



There are core sizes for basketballs: Size 5, Size 6 and Size 7. 

The size you require depends on the age of the player concerned and also the sex of the player.

A size 5 basketball, is designed for players up to age 9. The ball has a circumference of 27.75" and weighs approximately 18oz.

A size 6 basketball, is designed for players between the ages of 9 to 12. This is also the ball specified for Women. The ball has a circumference of 28.5" and weighs approximately 20oz.

A size 7 basketball, is designed for all male players, 13 years and above. The ball has a circumference of 29.5" and weighs 22oz.








See more

Foam backed design for excellent feel
Designed for indoor and outdoor play
